metaphor.core: Voldemort's Horcruxes, where he splits his soul into multiple pieces to achieve immortality, is used to explain code splitting and lazy loading in React, allowing an application to split its bundle into smaller, independently loadable chunks for better performance and resilience.
metaphor.narrativeArc: The module follows Voldemort's journey from a monolithic entity to a fragmented one through Horcruxes, mirroring the progression from a single large JavaScript bundle to smaller, lazy-loaded components. The narrative illustrates the problems of monolithic applications (single point of failure) and the benefits of code splitting (resilience, performance) by showing the 'hunt' for individual Horcrux-like code chunks.

problems: Single point of failure in monolithic applications

chapters.title: The All-or-Nothing Soul
chapters.focus: Introduces the concept of a monolithic application bundle and its drawbacks.

chapters.title: The Godric's Hollow Crash
chapters.focus: Demonstrates the single point of failure in monolithic applications.

chapters.title: The Soul Divided
chapters.focus: Explains the concept of code splitting and lazy loading using React.lazy and Suspense.

chapters.title: Monolith vs. Plague
chapters.focus: Compares monolithic vs. code-split approaches and their impact on performance and resilience.

chapters.title: Hunting the Pieces
chapters.focus: Illustrates the systematic loading of code-split chunks and optimal chunk configuration.
